Class Piece

java.lang.Object
  Piece

public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object

Constructor Summary
Piece(int x, int y, boolean color)
          The constructor Piece(int x, int y, boolean color) takes a square on the board as parameter, sets the squareOn field to that value, and the x and y location to that value multiplied by 62, as each chess square is 62 pixels wide and tall.

Constructor Detail

Piece

public Piece(int x,
             int y,
             boolean color)
The constructor Piece(int x, int y, boolean color) takes a square on the board as parameter, sets the squareOn field to that value, and the x and y location to that value multiplied by 62, as each chess square is 62 pixels wide and tall. Selected is initially set to false.

Parameters:
x -
y -
Method Detail

public java.awt.Point getSquareOn()
The getSquareOn method returns the square that the piece is on as a point object

Returns:
Point, the square that the piece is on

the setSelected(boolean selected) method sets the selected field to the parameter selected.

Parameters:
selected -

isSelected

public boolean isSelected()
The method isSelected returns whether or not the piece is selected.

Returns:
boolean, true if piece is selected, false if piece is not selected

getLocation

public java.awt.Point getLocation()
the getLocation() method returns the location of the piece as a Point, with the pixel location x,y

Point, the location of the piece

the getX() method returns the x value of the location of the piece

public int getY()
the getY() method returns the y-value of the location of the piece.

contains

public boolean contains(java.awt.geom.Point2D p)
The contains(Point2D p) method takes a Point2D as a parameter and checks if the point lies on the piece. The method checks this by checking if if the point that the user clicked was between x and x+62 and between y and y+62, as each square has width and height of 62 pixels

Parameters:
p -
Returns:
boolean, true if point is contained, false if it is not

translate

public void translate(int dx,
                      int dy)
The translate method is used when a piece is being dragged and it moves the piece by parameters dx and dy.

Parameters:
dx -
dy -

setLocation

public boolean setLocation(int row,
                           int col)
The setLocation(int row, int col) takes a row and column from the board as parameters, sets x and y to those multiplied by 62, and sets the squareOn point to that point. Used to set a piece on a given square

Parameters:
row -
col -

getColor

public boolean getColor()

getType

public abstract java.lang.String getType()
The getType() method returns the type of piece(ie. rook, king, bishop)

Returns:
String, the type of piece

checkLegalMove

public abstract boolean checkLegalMove(java.awt.Point p,
                                       Board b)
The checkLegalMove(Point p) method takes a point in pixels and determines whether the move is legal or not for the piece

boolean, true if move is legal, false if it is not
